org.xwalk.core

Class XWalkInitializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xwalk.core.XWalkInitializer

  • public class XWalkInitializer
extends java.lang.Object

    XWalkInitializer is an alternative to XWalkActivity with the difference that it provides a way to initialize the Crosswalk runtime in background silently. Another advantage is that the developer can use their own activity class directly rather than having it extend XWalkActivity. However, XWalkActivity is still recommended because it makes the code simpler.

    If the initialization failed, which means the Crosswalk runtime doesn't exist or doesn't match the app, you could use XWalkUpdater to prompt the user to download suiteble Crosswalk runtime.

    For example:

     public class MyActivity extends Activity implements XWalkInitializer.XWalkInitListener {
     XWalkView mXWalkView;
     XWalkInitializer mXWalkInitializer;

     @Override
     protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
         super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);

         // Must call initAsync() before anything that involes the embedding API, including
         // invoking setContentView() with the layout which holds the XWalkView object.

         mXWalkInitializer = new XWalkInitializer(this, this);
         mXWalkInitializer.initAsync();

         // Until onXWalkInitCompleted() is invoked, you should do nothing with the embedding API
         // except the following:
         // 1. Instanciate the XWalkView object
         // 2. Call XWalkPreferences.setValue()
         // 3. Call XWalkView.setUIClient()
         // 4. Call XWalkView.setResourceClient()

         XWalkPreferences.setValue(XWalkPreferences.ANIMATABLE_XWALK_VIEW, true);

         setContentView(R.layout.activity_xwalkview);
         mXWalkView = (XWalkView) findViewById(R.id.xwalkview);
         mXWalkView.setUIClient(new MyXWalkUIClient(mXWalkView));
         mXWalkView.setResourceClient(new MyXWalkResourceClient(mXWalkView));
     }

     @Override
     public void onXWalkInitCompleted() {
         // Do anyting with the embedding API
         mXWalkView.load("http://crosswalk-project.org/", null);
     }

     @Override
     public void onXWalkInitStarted() {
     }

     @Override
     public void onXWalkInitCancelled() {
         // Perform error handling here
     }

     @Override
     public void onXWalkInitFailed() {
         // Perform error handling here, or launch the XWalkUpdater
     }
 }

    • Constructor Detail

      • XWalkInitializer

        public XWalkInitializer(XWalkInitializer.XWalkInitListener listener,
                android.app.Activity activity)
        Create an initializer for single activity.

        This method must be invoked on the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - The XWalkInitializer.XWalkInitListener to use.
        activity - The activity which initiate the initialization

    • Method Detail

      • initAsync

        public boolean initAsync()
        Initialize the Crosswalk runtime in background asynchronously.

        This method must be invoked on the UI thread.

        Returns:
        Return true if initialization started, false if another initialization is proceeding or Crosswalk initialization is already completed successfully.

      • cancelInit

        public boolean cancelInit()
        Attempt to cancel the initialization.
        Returns:
        False if the initialization is not proceeding or can't be cancelled, true otherwise.
